description: Been using this for a month or two--love it! So much more user-friendly than Recoll, which I was using previously and whose instructions are almost impenetrable. I have a huge amount of writing in a complex of documents and directories and it's so simple to search for words of phrases WHERE I WANT TO SEARCH FOR THEM.

Highly recommended as it enables keyword searches to be mad possible quickly. For instance, I use it to parse the Holy Scriptures for key reference words used in many of the books and chapters. Like Jesus and Micah. Great for research too. Thanks Jr! Excellent recommendation. 

And now on to file.wikileaks.org

This is the only program I found for Linux which can actually search contents of various documents. It is also user-friendly - the folder where you want to search can be found quickly just by typing its name. It is fast.
summary: The only one which actually works

description: I used to work with always, it is very usefull
Installed okay, but the application never opens.

What index? Where?
If that isn't there on the free version then the pro version is not getting bought.
summary: Load up the indexing and start searching?

description:
To the reviewer who said "what index where", you specify what is indexed - just look in the bottom left hand corner.

This is really well written - a very elegant and useful tool that I have been using daily for over a year.
Another program you have to study to be able to use a simple search.

This is the only utility I've found that can allow you to search the contents of files like which is easy to do on Windows.  I found the interface confusing and also the manual but after searching on youtube there is a good video called 'how to use docfether' which explains how to use the program.  Basically you have to select a folder / directory you want to search and create an index first and then search for what you want in the folder.  Very easy to use once you know how.
summary: Enables you to search the contents of files just like on Windows

description:
On Ubuntu 22.04 snap version gave me troubles: 
1) I had to give it all permissions to use it on mounted HDD
2) Even then it will still pepper my terminal with permission complains for some system files, like "Failed to open file “/sys/class/dmi/id/chassis_type”: Permission denied"
3) Many .xls files were not opened while building the index
4) Finally search produced no results - I used exactly the same keywork with xlsxgrep and got many hits.

Something is deeply wrong here.

Bietet ausgeklügelte Suchfunktionen, von denen man garnicht wusste, das es sie so gibt... Man muss sich etwas einarbeiten, aber es lohnt sich. Läuft stabil, ist schnell und findet alles wieder. Nutze es für meine umfangreiche Pdf - Sammlungen diverser Zeitschriften, eBooks usw. Vielen Dank an die Entwickler und jene die es pflegen!
Busca incluso en los contenidos de los documentos de texto
Busca bien en documentos de texto y su contenido
